content: btw, not sure if this was done already or what, but it's really easy to integrate mermaid for rendering graphs and other things, and I think we should totally do that. We could also integrate [mdbook-graphviz] although I don't like the approach that particular plugin takes. I think a better approach would be to use viz.js to do the rendering in the client (and not require that graphviz is installed).
See for example the chalk book for why this kind of thing is useful
@nikomatsakis #t-compiler/wg-rustc-dev-guide > integrate mermaid project into rustc-dev-guide
I couldn't remember if I had brought it up before
Yep, @Chris Simpkins and @LeSeulArtichaut had also done some great work on some diagrams before, but we didn't get around to polishing and merging them
no worries, just wanted to point out that it was received with huge thumbs ups :)
